abstract: The world's newest country, South Sudan, is already beset by age-old border disputes.
snippet: The world's newest country, South Sudan, is already beset by age-old border disputes.
lead_paragraph: Oh, to have been in that room in Juba, the capital of South Sudan, on Oct. 16. That's when the leadership of the world's newest country met with Xanana Gusmão, the prime minister of East Timor, the first new country of the 21st century [1]. Surely, Mr. Gusmão must have lectured on the nitty gritty of starting up a brand new country. And undoubtedly, talk must have turned to borders: how to demarcate, secure and police them. (Yes, such are the daydreams of borderspotters like myself.)

headline.main: Fresh Scars on the Body Politic
